intro: Moehringia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed moehringia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae, which includes roses and strawberries, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. Moehringia crassifolia is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
